MAN.TITLE: ROOTS

PARAM_DESCRIPTION.SP: : polynomial with real or complex coefficients or vector of the polynomial coefficients in decreasing degree order (Matlab compatibility).

DESCRIPTION.P: x=roots(p) returns in the complex vector x the roots of the polynomial p. For real polynomials of degree <=100 the fast RPOLY algorithm is used. In the other cases the roots are computed as the eigenvalues of the associated companion matrix. Use x=roots(p,'e') to force this algorithm in any cases.

MAN.EXAMPLE: p=poly([0,10,1+%i,1-%i],'x'); roots(p) A=rand(3,3);roots(poly(A,'x')) // Evals by characteristic polynomial spec(A)

BIBLIO.SP: The RPOLY algorithm is described in ACM TOMS 1 (1975) 178-189

USED_FUNCTIONS.SP: The rpoly.f source codes can be found in the directory routines/control of a Scilab source distribution. The eigenvalue computation is perfomed using DGEEV and ZGEEV LAPACK codes.
